review: This thing works well and pretty much streams flawlessly with my admittedly decent net connection.  A couple of things would make it even better.  First, as others have noted, there should be a simple Amazon Prime view so that you can easily browse the free stuff.  Secondly... Voice search doesn't seem to search Netflix, though it works well with Hulu.  Really, really wish voice search worked with the Netflix app.  All that said, the only thing keeping it from 5 stars really is the lack of the Amazon Prime-only view.  It's fast and easy to use with an impressive number of apps.
author: Joleen Shook "-J. Shook"

review: Powerful and cheap with the preholiday deal. Not a fan of Amazons sandboxing of this product, but was cheap enough to live with.If youre using kodi/xbmc, let me save you a headache, choose software rendering only and turn off multi-threading, otherwise you're videos will be choppy and unwatchable.
author: Ryan M

review: Ok, this is tough, because I love Amazon. I have Amazon prime and I also have Netflix. We have Apple tv downstairs and now Fire TV upstairs. I did have Chromecast, but hated having to use an app to control the tv. So, I have used all three. I hate to say, Apple tv, to me, is the best... now Fire tv is a great competitor, but I do think I prefer the menu on the apple tv. I also have had some issues with Netflix on Fire tv, and haven't on the Apple. So, if I had to rate the three... it would be Apple tv, Fire tv and then I wouldn't bother with anything that doesn't have a remote!!
